name: Data Science: Principles and Practice
course_description: This course will introduce the topics of data science and machine learning by covering foundational statistical principles for handling and learning from data. The course will teach statistical techniques for making more informed decisions and interpreting those results through visualization. The student will learn to implement these techniques in Python, while gaining programming skills such as version control, testing, and efficient programming practices.
bullet_points: Learn foundational statistical principles for data science
Implement machine learning techniques in Python
Develop skills in data visualization and interpretation

name: Introductory Applied Machine Learning
course_description: Introduction to the basic principles of machine learning and the kinds of problems that can be solved by such techniques. This course provides an overview of many concepts, techniques, and algorithms in machine learning, beginning with topics such as classification and linear regression and ending up with more recent topics such as boosting, support vector machines, hidden Markov models, and Bayesian networks.
bullet_points: Learn fundamental concepts of machine learning
Implement classification and regression models
Gain practical experience with modern ML algorithms

name: Statistical Methods
course_description: This course provides an introduction to core statistical concepts and methods with an emphasis on applications. Topics include: exploratory data analysis; probability distributions; estimation; hypothesis testing; p-values; correlation and regression; analysis of categorical data; Bayesian methods; and nonparametric methods.
bullet_points: Develop core statistical skills for data analysis
Learn practical methods for hypothesis testing
Apply statistical concepts to real-world problems

name: Informatics 2D - Databases
course_description: This course introduces key concepts and techniques of database management systems, including data modeling, database design, and data querying. The course covers the relational model, SQL, normalization, transaction management, and explores new trends in database technology such as NoSQL databases, distributed databases, and data warehousing.
bullet_points: Understand foundational database concepts
Develop skills in SQL and data modeling
Explore trends in modern database technologies

name: Introduction to Data Science
course_description: This course provides a foundation in data science concepts, tools, and techniques. Students will learn to collect, analyze, and visualize data using Python. The course covers principles of data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, statistical inference, and introduces basic machine learning concepts. Students will work on practical projects to gain hands-on experience.
bullet_points: Learn data science fundamentals with Python
Practice data cleaning and exploratory analysis
Develop skills in data visualization and presentation

name: Big Data in Marketing
course_description: This course explores how big data analytics is transforming marketing practices. Students will learn about sources of marketing data, methods for analyzing large datasets, and applications for marketing decision-making. Topics include customer segmentation, predictive analytics, recommendation systems, and ethical considerations in marketing analytics.
bullet_points: Understand how big data is revolutionizing marketing
Learn analytical methods for customer insights
Apply big data concepts to marketing problems

name: Statistical Programming
course_description: This course provides a practical introduction to statistical programming using R. Students will learn to implement various statistical methods, create visualizations, and develop reproducible analyses. The course covers data manipulation, exploratory data analysis, statistical modeling, and the creation of interactive reports.
bullet_points: Develop proficiency in R for statistical analysis
Create effective data visualizations
Build reproducible statistical workflows
